title: Review: ‘Wake Up Dead Man’ is the darkest ‘Knives Out’ movie yet
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Movie Reviews Rian Johnson's "Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery" is more Edgar Allan Poe than Agatha Christie, with Benoit Blanc solving an "impossible" mystery at a rural church.
Mila Kunis, Daniel Craig and Josh O’Connor in "Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery.

title: R.I. officials nab alleged undersized fish poachers from Mass.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The boat's owner is facing charges.
Three Massachusetts men were intercepted for marine fisheries violations in Rhode Island last week, authorities said.

Environmental police in Newport discovered the three men in possession of 48 tautog and 21 black sea bass, of which 47 and 20 were undersized, respectively, according to the Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management.

title: Woman with family connections to White House press secretary detained by ICE in Revere
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Bruna Caroline Ferreria is the mother of White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt’s nephew.
White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt speaks with reporters at the White House.

Evan Vucci / AP, File A woman who has ties to the family of White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt was detained by ICE agents in Massachusetts earlier this month, according to her lawyer and White House officials.

title: Concord man arrested for signs targeting superintendent
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime This is the second time John Grace, 56, has been charged for threatening or harassing Concord's superintendent.
A Concord man was arrested Tuesday for allegedly violating a Harassment Protection Order from the superintendent of the Concord and Concord-Carlisle Regional school districts.

title: Craig Breslow discussed the potential of adding more help to Red Sox starting rotation
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "We still intend to improve our team.
" Craig Breslow during a Red Sox press conference in October.

AP Photo/Charles Krupa By Hayden Bird November 26, 2025 | 10:47 AM 3 minutes to read Craig Breslow spoke after the Sonny Gray trade: Following the notable addition of right-handed starting pitcher Sonny Gray to the Red Sox rotation on Tuesday via a trade with the Cardinals, Boston Chief Baseball Officer Craig Breslow spoke to the media to provide some context.

title: Large group of masked assailants robbed juveniles of e-bike at gunpoint in Norwood, police say
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Police report the investigation led to multiple arrests and the seizure of guns and narcotics from nearby homes.
Norwood police arrested several people — including two juveniles — after a group of armed, masked assailants robbed two boys of an e-bike, jacket, and shoes, authorities said.
The investigation quickly widened, leading officers to seize firearms, drug-distribution materials, and narcotics from two nearby homes.
